snippet: At many summer camps, the food in the dining hall is no longer an afterthought and cooking is just as much an activity as water-skiing.
abstract: Summer camp food has increasingly become camp cuisine, transformed from an afterthought to a prominent place at the table with camps no longer hiring cooks, but chefs; rising number of campers and counselors with food allergies has also prompted change.
lead_paragraph: At many summer camps, the food in the dining hall is no longer an afterthought and cooking is just as much an activity as water-skiing.

headline.seo: At Summer Camp, Young Foodies Raise the Bar
headline.main: At Camp, It’s Not Grub, It’s Cuisine
headline.print_headline: At Camp, It’s Not Grub, It’s Cuisine
